isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - TIMING GEAR TRAIN AND FRONT COVER - TIMING GEAR TRAIN - REMOVAL

step1.para:
Remove idler gear as follows: ( Figure 8.14
)

step2.para: Loosen and remove the idler gear retaining bolt.
Remove the idler gear assembly and spacer (thin washer) from the crankcase.

note.para: The idler gear is supported on two tapered roller bearings and a shaft. The roller bearings are serviced as an assembly.

svcsubproc.title: Camshaft Gear
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to "ROCKER ARM ASSEMBLY, CAMSHAFT, TAPPETS AND PUSH RODS"
for the camshaft gear removal procedure.

note.para: The camshaft gear must be pressed off the camshaft since it is a shrink fit. Remove only if damaged or worn.

svcsubproc.title: Crankshaft Gear and Oil Pump Drive Spline

step1.para:
Refer to VIBRATION DAMPER, CRANKSHAFT, MAIN BEARINGS, FLYWHEEL AND CRANKCASE
for the crankshaft gear and oil pump drive spline removal procedure.

note.para: These gears should be removed only if they fail visual inspection.
The injection pump drive gear must be removed when removing the engine front cover.

step1.para: The drive gear can be removed without removing the engine front cover, by removing the injection pump drive gear access cover. Refer to FUEL INJECTION PUMP for the injection pump drive gear removal procedure.
With the camshaft and idler gear removed, remove the front plate as follows:

step2.para:
Remove the four retaining bolts which secure the front plate to the crankcase. Refer to Figure 8.15
.
Lift the front plate off the alignment dowels on the crankcase.
Discard the gasket and clean any gasket material from the front plate or crankcase.
